result.execSummary:
The defendant Amanda L Michell was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property >$10,000, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Restitution to be paid as a condition of probation, before any costs or fines. Restitution hearing also to be held at future date.   10/23/2014 PER RESTITUTION HEARING - AMOUNTS FOR VICTIMS REMAIN. DEFENDANT TO MAKE PAYMENTS TO AGENT AT $250.00 PER MONTH WHILE ON SUPERVISION. UNPAID BALANCE WILL BE CONVERTED TO A CIVIL JUDGMENT.
Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered.
Inform agent of all prescriptions. 
Sign medical releases for agent.

No Contact with any victims listed in the criminal complaint. Provide DNA Specimen unless previously obtained. Surcharge is imposed. Maintain employment and/or school combinations. Follow through with any treatment or counseling recommended by agent. 
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

cover letter to Attorney Helen Mullison sending the record.

Defendant Amanda L Michell appears by telephone.  Attorney Daniel P Fay appears in court.  Andrea M. Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Fay states that parties have reached an agreement.  Parties stipulate and court sets restitution at $500,000.00 on this case to victims (jointly) on this case.  Upon agreement of the parties, Defendant will pay $250.00 per month as condition of extended supervision.  Any unpaid amount to be converted to civil judgment after extended supervision is complete.
Transcript received and filed for the following date and event: 08/29/14 sentencing hearing.

records.descr: Notice of intent to pursue post-conviction relief

records.addlTxt: Restitution hearing on October 23, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Amanda L Michell in court, in custody, with Attorney Daniel P. Fay.  District Attorney's Office Law Intern Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for sentencing hearing.  Victim makes statements.  State gives sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Fay makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.  Attorney Fay requests restitution hearing.  Defendant to appear by videoconference for restitution hearing.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #1:  WITHHELD SENTENCE:      

TERM OF PROBATION:  5 YEARS     **CONSECUTIVE TO CASE #13CF1290**


CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISON:  
____AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
____Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
____No Use or Possession of alcohol or illegal drugs 
____No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
____Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are 
prescribed/sign releases.
____Inform Agent of all prescriptions
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
____No contact with: victims listed in criminal complaint
____DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done 

RESTITUTION:  $500,000.00  (to be paid as a condition of extended supervision -  restitution to be paid before costs or fines) 

COSTS:  $278.00 (to be paid as a condition of extended supervision)


Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
 
  Restitution hearing scheduled for October 23, 2014 at 01:30 pm.  Restitution hearing scheduled for October 23, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count #1.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Count #1.  State will be requesting $500,000.00 in restitution on this case.  Attorney Fay requests a presentence investigation.  Court orders presentence investigation.  Sentencing date is scheduled.    Bail remains as fixed.
